subject: Communication
title: Apology Science: What Actually Works
description: A quick, practical guide to Apology Science: What Actually Works.

hook.text: 'I'm sorry you feel that way' isn't an apology. It's a passive-aggressive dismissal wearing an apology mask.

buildup.text: Research identifies six components of effective apology: expression of regret, explanation, responsibility.

discovery.text: The most powerful component? Accepting responsibility. Without it, the rest feels hollow and performative.

twist.text: Over-apologizing erodes trust too. Chronic apologizers signal low competence.

climax.text: A good apology acknowledges harm, accepts responsibility, explains what will change, and asks nothing in return.

punchline.text: A real apology isn't about your guilt. It's about their pain.

quiz.question: What is the most powerful component of an effective apology?
